trans-unit.source: Availability of Service Fabric Services
trans-unit.target: Availability of Service Fabric Services

trans-unit.source: Describes fault detection, failover, recovery for services
trans-unit.target: Describes fault detection, failover, recovery for services

trans-unit.source: Service Fabric services can be either stateful or stateless.
trans-unit.target: Service Fabric services can be either stateful or stateless.

trans-unit.source: This article gives an overview of how Service Fabric maintains availability of a service in the event of failures.
trans-unit.target: This article gives an overview of how Service Fabric maintains availability of a service in the event of failures.

trans-unit.source: A stateless service is an application service that does not have any <linkText>local persistent state</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: A stateless service is an application service that does not have any <linkText>local persistent state</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Creating a stateless service requires defining an instance count which is the number of instances of the stateless service that should be running in the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Creating a stateless service requires defining an instance count which is the number of instances of the stateless service that should be running in the cluster.

trans-unit.source: These are the number of copies of the application logic that will be instantiated in the cluster.
trans-unit.target: These are the number of copies of the application logic that will be instantiated in the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Increasing the number of instances is the recommended way of scaling out stateless services.
trans-unit.target: Increasing the number of instances is the recommended way of scaling out stateless services.

trans-unit.source: When a fault is detected on any instance of the stateless service a new instance is created on some other eligible node in the cluster.
trans-unit.target: When a fault is detected on any instance of the stateless service a new instance is created on some other eligible node in the cluster.

trans-unit.source: A Stateful Service has some state that is associated with it.
trans-unit.target: A Stateful Service has some state that is associated with it.

trans-unit.source: In Service Fabric, a stateful service is modeled as a set of replicas.
trans-unit.target: In Service Fabric, a stateful service is modeled as a set of replicas.

trans-unit.source: Each replica is an instance of the code of the service that has a copy of the state.
trans-unit.target: Each replica is an instance of the code of the service that has a copy of the state.

trans-unit.source: Read and Write operations are performed at one replica (called the Primary).
trans-unit.target: Read and Write operations are performed at one replica (called the Primary).

trans-unit.source: Changes to state due to write operations are replicated to multiple other replicas (called the Active Secondaries).
trans-unit.target: Changes to state due to write operations are replicated to multiple other replicas (called the Active Secondaries).

trans-unit.source: This combination of Primary and Active Secondary replicas is the replica set of the service.
trans-unit.target: This combination of Primary and Active Secondary replicas is the replica set of the service.

trans-unit.source: There can be only one Primary that is servicing read and write requests.
trans-unit.target: There can be only one Primary that is servicing read and write requests.

trans-unit.source: There can be multiple Active Secondary replicas.
trans-unit.target: There can be multiple Active Secondary replicas.

trans-unit.source: The number of Active Secondary replicas is configurable and a higher number of replicas allows for tolerating a greater number of concurrent software and hardware failures.
trans-unit.target: The number of Active Secondary replicas is configurable and a higher number of replicas allows for tolerating a greater number of concurrent software and hardware failures.

trans-unit.source: In the event of a fault (when the Primary replica goes down), Service Fabric makes one of the Active Secondary replicas the new Primary replica.
trans-unit.target: In the event of a fault (when the Primary replica goes down), Service Fabric makes one of the Active Secondary replicas the new Primary replica.

trans-unit.source: This Active Secondary replica already has the updated version of the state (via replication) and can continue processing further read and write operations.
trans-unit.target: This Active Secondary replica already has the updated version of the state (via replication) and can continue processing further read and write operations.

trans-unit.source: This concept of a replica being a Primary or a Active Secondary is known as the replica role.
trans-unit.target: This concept of a replica being a Primary or a Active Secondary is known as the replica role.

trans-unit.source: The Role of a replica is used to manage the lifecycle of the state being managed by that replica.
trans-unit.target: The Role of a replica is used to manage the lifecycle of the state being managed by that replica.

trans-unit.source: A replica whose role is primary is servicing read requests.
trans-unit.target: A replica whose role is primary is servicing read requests.

trans-unit.source: It is also servicing write requests by updating its state and replicating the changes to the Active Secondaries in its replica set.
trans-unit.target: It is also servicing write requests by updating its state and replicating the changes to the Active Secondaries in its replica set.

trans-unit.source: An Active Secondary is responsible for receiving state changes that the Primary replica has replicated and updating its view of the state.
trans-unit.target: An Active Secondary is responsible for receiving state changes that the Primary replica has replicated and updating its view of the state.

trans-unit.source: Higher level programming models such as the <linkText>Reliable Actors framework</linkText><title></title> abstract away the concept of replica role from the developer.
trans-unit.target: Higher level programming models such as the <linkText>Reliable Actors framework</linkText><title></title> abstract away the concept of replica role from the developer.

trans-unit.target: For information on Service Fabric concepts, see the following:

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Partitioning Service Fabric Services</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Defining and Managing State</linkText><title></title>
